intro: Falcaria pastinacifolia, commonly known as the creeping buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils such as roadsides and meadows. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers with five petals. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes other toxic plants like the water dropwort. However, it is not considered highly toxic to humans, though it can cause skin irritation in some individuals.
